item.title: Windows 10 to let admins control how optional updates are deployed
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan

description.#cdata-section: Microsoft announced a new policy that allows admins to control how optional updates are deployed on Windows 10 enterprise endpoints on their networks. [...]

item.title: FCC adopts new rules to protect consumers from SIM-swapping attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan

description.#cdata-section: The Federal Communications Commission (FCC) has revealed new rules to shield consumers from criminals who hijack their phone numbers in SIM swapping attacks and port-out fraud. [...]

item.title: Exploit for CrushFTP RCE chain released, patch now
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas

description.#cdata-section: A proof-of-concept exploit was publicly released for a critical remote code execution vulnerability in the CrushFTP enterprise suite, allowing unauthenticated attackers to access files on the server, execute code, and obtain plain-text passwords. [...]

item.title: Google shares plans for blocking third-party cookies in Chrome
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar

description.#cdata-section: Google has officially announced plans to gradually eliminate third-party cookies, a key aspect of its Privacy Sandbox initiative. [...]

item.title: The Week in Ransomware - November 17th 2023 - Citrix in the Crosshairs
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams

description.#cdata-section: Ransomware gangs target exposed Citrix Netscaler devices using a publicly available exploit to breach large organizations, steal data, and encrypt files. [...]

item.title: Bloomberg Crypto X account snafu leads to Discord phishing attack
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan

description.#cdata-section: The official Twitter account for Bloomberg Crypto was used earlier today to redirect users to a deceptive website that stole Discord credentials in a phishing attack. [...]

item.title: Yamaha Motor confirms ransomware attack on Philippines subsidiary
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan

description.#cdata-section: Yamaha Motor's Philippines motorcycle manufacturing subsidiary was hit by a ransomware attack last month, resulting in the theft and leak of some employees' personal information. [...]

item.title: Google: Hackers exploited Zimbra zero-day in attacks on govt orgs
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas

description.#cdata-section: Hackers leveraged a medium-severity security issue now identified as CVE-2023-37580 since June 29, nearly a month before the vendor addressed it in version 8.8.15 Patch 41of the software on July 25. [...]

item.title: CISA warns of actively exploited Windows, Sophos, and Oracle bugs
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas

description.#cdata-section: The U.S. Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency has added to its catalog of known exploited vulnerabilities (KEV) three security issues that affect Microsoft devices, a Sophos product, and an enterprise solution from Oracle. [...]

item.title: British Library: Ongoing outage caused by ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan

description.#cdata-section: The British Library confirmed that a ransomware attack is behind a major outage that is still affecting services across several locations. [...]

item.title: Long Beach, California turns off IT systems after cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams

description.#cdata-section: The City of Long Beach in California is warning that they suffered a cyberattack on Tuesday that has led them to shut down portions of their IT network to prevent the attack's spread. [...]

item.title: FBI shares tactics of notorious Scattered Spider hacker collective
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas

description.#cdata-section: The Federal Bureau of Investigation and the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency released an advisory about the evasive threat actor tracked as Scattered Spider, a loosely knit hacking collective that now collaborates with the ALPHV/BlackCat Russian ransomware operation.. [...]

item.title: MySQL servers targeted by 'Ddostf' DDoS-as-a-Service botnet
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas

description.#cdata-section: MySQL servers are being targeted by the 'Ddostf' malware botnet to enslave them for a DDoS-as-a-Service platform whose firepower is rented to other cybercriminals. [...]
